meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Sam Gale Doug Behrend Sarah Thompson Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #7265.

td.p: Sam Gale, a test reader and evaluator from Kernersville, North Carolina
Doug Behrend, a college professor from Fayetteville, Arkansas
Sarah Thompson, an art history professor from Rochester, New York (whose 1-day cash winnings total $16,999)

tr.td: WORDS THAT SHOULD RHYME
PLAYTIME WITH SHAKESPEARE
SPOT THE CANADIAN
CONTAINERS
U.S. GEOGRAPHY
(Alex: A whole category on the brilliant...)
AUDRA McDONALD ON BROADWAY

div.h3: Scores at the end of the Jeopardy! Round:

tr.td: Sarah
Doug
Sam
A CATEGORY FULL OF COR(E)YS
PHILOSOPHY
GANG GREEN
(Alex: Each correct response...)
STARTS WITH ONE LETTER, ENDS WITH THE NEXT
HALT!
WHO GOES THERE
(Alex: But the WHO in this case is WHO--the World Health Organization.)

tr.td: Sarah
Doug
Sam

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', '(Alex: I figure this is going to be easy for you three.)
SamWhat is the atomic clock?
$2,900
SarahWhat is a nuclear an atomic clock
$6,000
DougWhat is an atomic clock?
$7,201
an atomic clock')
div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', 'In the 1950s physicist Louis Essen built the 1st practical one of these, noting that it wouldn\'t give you the time of day')

tr.td: 20th CENTURY INVENTIONS
In the 1950s physicist Louis Essen built the 1st practical one of these, noting that it wouldn't give you the time of day
Sarah
Doug
Sam
2nd place: $2,000
New champion: $16,401
3rd place: $1,000
Sarah
Doug
Sam

(including 1 DD),

body.div: The J! Archive is created by fans, for fans. The Jeopardy! game show and all elements thereof, including but not limited to copyright and trademark thereto, are the property of Jeopardy Productions, Inc. and are protected under law. This website is not affiliated with, sponsored by, or operated by Jeopardy Productions, Inc. Join the discussion at JBoard.tv.
